data.name: Genghis Khan
accomplishment: United the Mongol tribes and established the Mongol Empire
Conquered vast swathes of territory in Asia and Europe
Introduced a number of reforms that helped to stabilize and unify the Mongol Empire
Expanded trade and cultural exchange across the Mongol Empire

data.name: Ögödei Khan
accomplishment: Expanded the Mongol Empire into China, Central Asia, and the Middle East
Established a system of roads and communication that helped to unify the empire
Promoted religious tolerance and trade
Built the Mongol capital city of Karakorum

data.name: Kublai Khan
accomplishment: Established the Yuan Dynasty in China
Expanded the Mongol Empire into Southeast Asia and Korea
Built the Grand Canal and other infrastructure projects
Promoted trade and cultural exchange between China and the rest of the world

data.name: Timur (Tamerlane)
accomplishment: Founded the Timurid Empire, which stretched from Central Asia to the Middle East
Conquered vast swathes of territory, including Persia, India, and Syria
Built a number of impressive architectural monuments, such as the Gur-e-Amir and the Bibi-Khanum Mosque

data.name: Zanabazar
accomplishment: The First Jebtsundamba Khutuktu, the spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhism in Mongolia
A renowned sculptor and artist, he created many important Buddhist works of art
Built the Erdene Zuu Monastery, the first Buddhist monastery in Mongolia

data.name: Galdan Boshugtu Khan
accomplishment: Unified the western Mongol tribes and established the Junggar Khanate
Expanded the Junggar Khanate into Central Asia and Siberia
Promoted Tibetan Buddhism in the Junggar Khanate

data.name: Amarsanaa Khan
accomplishment: Rebelled against the Qing Dynasty and attempted to restore Mongol independence
Formed an alliance with Russia, but was eventually defeated by the Qing Dynasty

data.name: Damdin Sükhbaatar
accomplishment: Led the Mongolian Revolution of 1921, which overthrew the Qing Dynasty and established the Mongolian People's Republic
Served as the first Prime Minister of the Mongolian People's Republic

data.name: Hür-el Khan
accomplishment: Declared the independence of Mongolia from China in 1911
Established the Bogd Khanate of Mongolia
Reigned as the Bogd Khan of Mongolia until his death in 1924

data.name: Yondonjamtsaa Tseyenpiliin
accomplishment: A Mongolian poet, writer, and translator
Considered one of the most important figures in modern Mongolian literature
His works helped to promote Mongolian culture and identity during a time of great political and social upheaval

params.id: A unique identifier for each object
params.name: The name of the Mongolian historical figure
params.dateOfBirth: The date of birth of the Mongolian historical figure
params.countryOfBirth: The country of birth of the Mongolian historical figure
params.dateOfDeath: The date of death of the Mongolian historical figure
params.accomplishment: A list of the major accomplishments of the Mongolian historical figure
params.images: A list of URLs pointing to images of the Mongolian historical figure, allowing for visual reference
